Friends Only

 

it had to happen. BUT--
  • Fics for 100_situations will remain here, unlocked, of course :)
  • Other fics and fanmixes will be moved to , because I'm OCD like that. Feel free to watch it if you want to.

Okay. So this story is Completely True, and I think it's really funny, but in actuality it's probably not that funny.

Anyway, there's two things you should know first:

1. My neighbor has some foreign students from the local University. One of them is from China, and the other one my mom says might be from Korea.

2. There's this whole huge drama thing going on called 'Northern Pass'. It has to do with hydroelectricity, and a mew set of power lines. It'll make energy cheaper, create new jobs, etc., blah blah blah.

So my neighbor had to leave the other day to go to Delaware to pick up a horse to bring it to Pennsylvania, so she wanted my mom to feed the horses, and to watch the 'Boys' (basically drop them off at the Uni in the morning, and pick them up in the afternoon, and make sure they eat). And last night, when my mom got home, she said that one of the Boys, Fitzwilliam (the one from China; mom said it was his Americanized name, and I asked my mom if he was an Austen fan. She said that she didn't know), had been walking down the street when he saw a sign saying "Stop Northern Pass". (Seriously, it's a Big Deal.)

And poor Fitzy thought that that meant that he couldn't walk any further down the road. :(

But my mom said that one of them had been out at the time, and from the way my mom explained it, I assume that the neighbor explained to Fitzy that he could go past. (I'm hoping she just said it was something to get a message across, and not the whole background of it.)

But then my mom killed the funny by saying that in other countries, you could get shot for not listening to signs like that. :/

(Though today, my mom's boyfriend and I were driving home from splitting/stacking/and bringing in more wood for his friend & getting our own wood, and on one of the roads, there was a "Stop Northern Pass" sign. So my mom's boyfriend was like, 'Oh no, we can't go past it!'... and then like, 300 feet down the road, there was another, so he was like, 'We're trapped!')

So I finally got what I needed to complete my second Fountain Faerie quest (relatively cheaply, I may add), and so now I don't know what to get.

these are the colors that I have pets for already:

faerie xweetok


pea chia


plushie usul


pirate usul


pirate kacheek


plushie kacheek

Otherwise, I can basically paint any pet that a morphing potion doesn't cost over 1.2 million. Or a pet that can be traded for easily. So no Krawks, Draiks, or Lutaris.

Also, Sarah Connor Queen Cersei Lena Headey is going to be on White Collar! Which is great, because ever since T:TSCC was canceled, I was hoping she would find something new that I'd want to watch.

Apparently she's supposed to play a hacker who "gets close" to Mozzie. :D

And some people wish she'd also be on Covert Affairs just so she would be with Piper again. Which...even if she did go on CoAf, I still wouldn't watch that show.

The Rules:
1. People who have been tagged must write the answers on their blog and replace any question they dislike with a new, original question.
2. Tag six people. Don't refuse to do that. Don't tag who tagged you.


1. Make a list of 5 things you can see without getting up.
My palm pilot, my computer, a Virgo candle, a Pringles can, and my iPod.

02. How do you style your hair?
Usually I put it up and put a million little clips in it so it all stays up.

03. What are wearing now?
My Psych shirt that I won on Twitter and my grampa's old pajama pants.

04. What's your occupation?
I am... unemployed. :(

05. What do you hear right now?
Regina Spektor. And MASH.

06. What's your favorite guilty pleasure treat?
Oreos.

07. Are you hungry?
Not really.

08. Write the first word that comes to mind.
Poptart.

09. Dog person or cat person?
CAT PERSON! I hate dogs so much.

10. What song is currently stuck in your head?
I don't have one at the moment, but tomorrow I'll probably have a Regina Spektor song in my head or Cold War Kids.

11. What was the last thing you bought?
Tangled, mainly because of  . Though I totally should have bought a new mouse for my computer.

12. If you could afford to go anywhere in the world, where would you go?
Somewhere out of the Americas (North/Central/South).

13. Where do you see yourself in 5 minutes?
Either still in my chair (where I am now) or in bed (where I should be now)

14. Last book you read?
The House of the Scorpion. I really liked it.

15. What are you doing this weekend?
Helping my mom tomorrow where she works. As for Sunday... probably just staying around the house and going to take care of my neighbors' dog.

16. If you could play any musical instrument, which one would you play?
I'd like to play the piano.

17. How are you?
Extremely bored.

18. What are you doing tomorrow?
Helping my mom where she works.

19. What are you looking forward to the most?
Going back to my dad's at some point.

And...I tag no one.

••Happy new year, everyone! (there's still a little over two hours left to go here.)

•I didn't manage to read 20 YA/10 Adult books this past month. I managed to read like eleven YA books and one Adult book. So here's what I read:

Great/Glad I Read This books: The Lost Hero, The Maze Runner, The Children of Men, (The Scorch Trials)
Meh/No Opinion books: White Cat, The Last Olympian, The Battle of the Labyrinth, The Ask and the Answer, Forbidden, The Cardturner, Siren
Not Great/Why Did I Read This books: Virals, Elixir

So right off, all but one disutopian novel is in the 'great' section. I think that the only reason why The Ask and The Answer isn't there is because I didn't have any emotional attachments to any characters like I did in The Knife of Never Letting Go. Because there's always that one person who annoys you all the time because they're always around, but when they prove their worth and end up dying, it hurts like hell (Manchee, The Knife of Never Letting Go; Chuck, The Maze Runner). The Lost Hero is also in there because after reading the Percy Jackson series, I just like this new trio of Jason-Piper-Leo better than Percy-Annabeth-Grover. Plus Hedge is awesome.

The 'meh' books... The Percy Jackson books are there because even though I didn't really care for them that much, they were better than the first couple of books in the series and they really didn't belong in the "why did I read this?" section. Some parts were cute, like the end of The Battle of the Labyrinth when Nico visited Percy on his birthday, and Percy asked if he wanted some cake. :3 Though what I didn't like from The Last Olympian was the bickering between Persephone and Demeter. Also, considering that Persephone is only in the underworld for four months of the year for winter, why is she with Hades during the summer?

But again, the other books are there because I just didn't have that emotional connection. None were really that spectacular, and none of them really made me feel like crying. Though if you want to read a book that teaches you a little about the game of Bridge, I suggest The Cardturner by Louis Sachar. (Basically, Alton is hired to be a cardturner for his great-uncle who plays Bridge because he is blind (his last cardturner broke the rule of never asking, "Are you sure?") and while being with him learns the secrets of his family (like, supposedly his great-uncle's Bridge partner went crazy, but turns out that when she went into the asylum, she wasn't crazy - her senator husband was jealous that she was closer to the president than he was, and she kept on playing Bridge even after he told her to stop) and helps his great-uncle to become a life master or whatever, even after he dies.

And as for the "why did I read this?" books... when I heard that Kathy Reichs had a YA novel out, I was a bit skeptical. I mean, she was a good Adult writer (if her books are your thing), but I wasn't sure if she could pull it off. And it turns out...that I think that she can't. Tori Brennan is a little clone of Tempe. Down to drinking the diet coke. There's also a lot of it was exposition - explaining how the machine would get the dirt off the dog tags, explaining the Parvovirus, etc. Anyone who is interested in this stuff can use Google for this stuff.

Also? Clearly obvious that the iFollow was going to be used to track them. iFOLLOW. I mean, clearly.

••In five days, my mom is getting surgery done on her ear. In ten days, hopefully my braces come off - I'm going to be pissed if I have to move this appointment.

••I also finally watched Breakfast at Tiffany's. Though it figures that right after I buy the movie, it shows up within a week on TCM.

••I'm also trying to get The Tudors. I was hoping to get to Borders, as they had a two-day 50% off CD/boxed-set DVD sale (and The Tudors was on the list) but I couldn't and the sale ends today. :( However, I will keep after it. (And walmart only seems to have season 3. boo.)

Oh, and I also want to watch Misfits, but I can't find that anywhere. :(

ALSO, I'm super-excited for Skins. Both the US and UK shows. I already have a favorite for the US Skins: Abbud <3.

1. Go to Google (or Yahoo) and type, "You know you're from (your state) when...."
2. Cut and paste the list.
3. Bold the items that apply to you.

--snagged from  
Anyway, I decided that I'm going to do two of these, because I feel that I live in two states: Vermont and New Hampshire.

Your idea of a traffic jam is 10 cars waiting to pass a tractor on the highway.

Vacation means going up north to Pittsburg for the weekend.

You measure distance in hours.*

You know several people that have hit deer more than once.

You often switch from "heat" to "A/C" in the same day and back again.

You use a down comforter in the summer.

You drive at 65 mph through 2 feet of snow during a raging blizzard, without flinching.

You see people wearing hunting clothes at social events or church.

You install security lights on your house and garage and leave both unlocked.

You think of the major food groups as venison, cider, fish, and berries.

You carry jumper cables in your car and your girlfriend/wife knows how to use them.

There are 7 empty cars running in the parking lot at Cricenti's Market at any given time.

Your Grammie's birthday party was in the town hall and the whole town showed up.

You design your kids Halloween costume to fit over their snowsuit.

Driving is better in winter because all the potholes are filled with snow.

You know at least one person who has hit a moose.

You know all four seasons: almost winter, winter, still winter, and road construction. (and maybe a 5th -- mud!)

(Or -- tourist, foliage, skiing and mud)

It takes you 3 hours to go to the store for milk even when you're in a hurry because you have to stop and talk to everyone in town.

Your uncle mows the town common.

You buy your Christmas presents at the feed and grain store.

You've pulled over to let a flock of wild turkeys (or pheasants) cross the road.

You define summer as three months of bad sledding.

Snow tires come standard on all your cars and trucks.

You can't go barefoot until the snow is gone from the top of Mt. Moosilauke.

You refer to the Patriots as "we".

You can identify a Massachusetts accent.

You keep your potatoes and onions "down cella", and your canned goods on shelves in the "cella-way".

You know what cow-tipping is.

"Down South" to you means Boston.

You consider Manchester exotic.

You can actually pronounce "Kancamagus" and know what it is.**

You know what a bubbler is.

Your neighbor throws a party to celebrate his new machine shed.

You can recognize someone from Massachusetts from their driving.

You drink soda and refer to your dad or grandpa as "Pop".

You ride your ski-doo to meet your friends at a restaurant for dinner, and that's how they get there too!

You can actually pronounce and spell "Winnipesauke".***

You know where Contoocook is, and how to pronounce it.

You can visit Berlin, New London, Bethlehem, Lisbon, Lebanon and Dublin all in one afternoon.

You only know three spices: salt, pepper, and ketchup.

You're proud of the only NH President, though he's not remembered for much.

You've visited the homestead of Franklin Pierce, because he's the only President from New Hampshire.

You've seen mosquitoes with landing lights.

The local paper covers major headlines on one page, but requires four pages for local sports.

At least twice a year, your kitchen doubles as a meat processing plant.

Your snow blower gets stuck on the roof.

You think the start of deer season is a national holiday.

You find 0 degrees a little chilly.

* And when not able to do so, minutes apply as well.
** If it's anything other than a highway, then I don't know.
*** I'm sure I could spell it if I'm absolutely needed to.

THIS POST was linked to users at .

Be careful.

I mentioned 'Mafia' on Neopets.

Today, I was busy so when I got to a game, it was the end. And right before the link to the new board was posted, one of the frequent players/hosters said that we should be more careful because he got a warning for the game. He reposted on the new board, while adding that he was sure that the same person that reported him also reported dorkydexter.

So basically, until further notice, Mafia games were off.

Then, after he left, this moron came on the board. One saying that "mafia" is only the Italian mafia and other bullshit.

I told her that, no, there's other mafias: Russian Mafia, Irish Mafia, etc.

And then she was like, "Russians refer to themselves as the mob, and Irish call themselves the Family" and more bullshit. (She later admitted that I was right.) Then this other moron showed up, one who I'm sure played before and started badmouthing Mafia. And after people left the Mafia board, she started a new one called something like, "Long Live Avatar Games".

She was continuing to badmouth Mafia, saying that it was "off-topic" (true) and that it was all this other stuff.

One of their arguments (either the first moron or the second) was either, "KIDS MAY SEE MAFIA AND ONCE THEY GET OFFLINE THEY MAY JOIN ONE". What the fuck, seriously? There's a goddamn game where YOU SHOOT CLOWNS. Hey, maybe a kid will play that and decide to go off and shoot clowns once they get offline.

I made a post saying, "Mafia was no more off-topic than "OMG LINDSAY WENT TO JAIL!!!1!" and they replied, "At least it wasn't disgusting" or something. (It was a few hours ago.)

But another user said that they played it offline. And someone else was like, "that's fine, you play it with cards and such". Well how are you supposed to play online? And another user said that their sister, who was in fourth grade, played it too.

And you know what? When I was in fourth grade, I was 10. That's three years younger than the age of which you need to be without parental permission to be on the chat boards. Tell me, what's the real harm of playing online when people play it in school all the time?

(And besides, we toned it down. By the game which we ended early, it was no worse than the stuff that you'd see TNT say in the editorial or plots, or what users would say in their NT stories.)

This whole thing is STUPID.

You have awoken the great Turmaculus...

I got out of bed really early because my mom was yelling at me. I feel a bit strange because we've just moved to Idaho and there's a weird smell in the house. I'm so sad. My kitten got run over this afternoon. I found him when I was coming home from school. His head was all squished. I took some photos. I'll miss him. Poor kitty. Last night I had to go and pay Joshua's bail. He's such a jerk. He got arrested for punching the Walmart clerk in the face for refusing to sell him beer. He's only 16! I want to tell the world that my girlfriend Amy is the bomb! She made pizza last night, and even though I burnt my lips on the cheese, it was awesome!!! I am updating this journal for the first time in ages, because I've been in prison. Today, I got a digital camera! Yes! Here's ten thousand photographs of my cat. I want to say thanks to simon and Abbey and Dave and the other Simon for helping me on Saturday. You guys are the best. By the way, if you happen to find my wallet, keys or underwear, could you SMS me? Adrian has my number. I went to the doctor yesterday, and he said I have a terrible skin disease which prevents me from coming into contact with other human beings. And bipolar disorder. You should all do this quiz! It's amazingly accurate. You just put in your name and birthday, and it will tell you what your favourite sexual position is. That's enough for now. But I'll leave you with my favourite Buffy fan-fiction piece I wrote last year when I was in hospital. Created with the Gregor's Semi-Automatic LiveJournal Updater™. Update your journal today!

This weekend, I have watched two movies: I Love You, Man, and 17 Again.

I Love You, Man has to be the funniest rated R comedy I've seen. The others tried and failed. Miserably. Jason Segel was just awesome as Sydney, and Sydney reminded me of Marshall a little bit.

17 Again was funny as well. But there were more awkward moments in this movie (to me) than there were funny moments. And I just loved Thomas Lennon in this movie, and how he tried hooking up with Melora Hardin nearly the whole time. Overall, it was a little predictable. But I still loved Thomas Lennon (who was also in I Love You, Man, I should add.)

After former Darling Mermaid Darling Aunt Vivian found out that her niece Charlotte was actually alive, she left the house and changed her name. She went to the convent that Lily and Olive went to, and stayed there until she found the picture of Lily pregnant.

Not long after she left, Vivian, now named Virginia, met a watchmaker and fell in love. Unable to have a child, they adopted one and named him Gabriel.

She never once told anyone about her past.

~I need icons from tonight's episode.
~I need a Linderman icon, as well as a Meredith icon.

Right, so where to begin?

New 'ships:
--Meredith/Thompson. Don't hate me for it.
--Meredith/Flint. It had to have happened at least once.

It's awesome the way they matched things with what happened in the pilot and Six Months Ago. Though I'm pretty sure they messed up a few timelines, like when Noah was in Chandra's apartment, and when Peter was told about Arthur's "death".

Anyway, my favorite lines were Angela's line at Arthur's "funeral" about him not being a god, only a man, and Meredith's, "You remember what daddy used to say: God gave you a big sister instead of a brain."

But I really, really like the Meredith/Thompson story...and I had to go AWWW when he released her at the end, while Claire was running into the train below that she had set on fire.

Also, Linderman was pretty much awesome (and I swear to god that he loves her) when he heals her brain and helped her heal from what Arthur did.
I know the spoilers are vague, and aren't in any abundance, but I'll ger more afer I download the episode or something.

FOX predicted that Barack would sweep New England (Maine, New Hampshire, Vermont, Massachusetts, and maybe Connecticut and Rhode Island) back after the polls closed here. And now it's projected that he won them all...and then some.

Which is awesome.

And so right now, the count is:

Obama: 207 electoral votes
McCain: 135 electoral votes

Yayness.

I'm pissed that Sylaire fans are still in denial. And I'm definitely not talking about the river in Egypt.

Because so many of these theories they're coming up with are so fucking ridiculous.

Theory #1: Eric Doyle raped Meredith (because, y'know he definitely could. He's, like, the king of creepy) and then because she was ashamed of it, she lied and said that Nathan was the father. So since Nathan isn't the father, therefore Claire and Sylar aren't related and Claire can have the adorable baby Noah.

What Logic says: Angela would have known sometime that Nathan wouldn't be the father of Claire. If she knew before, then she would have kept Nathan somehow away from Meredith. Also, if she was raped before being with Nathan, then she probably wouldn't have wanted to get close enough to Nathan to have sex with him. Plus, Tim K. wanted P&C to be related in the first season.


Theory #2: Sylar had sex with Claire before now...and when HRG found out, he tortured and Haitian-ed Sylar, and then Haitian-ed Claire after she gave birth to baby Noah, as well as Lyle and Sandra. So the only people who know about baby Noah is Elle, HRG, and the Haitian. And Sylar is so mad at HRG that he pisses him off all the time (because by this time, he only knows that he had his mind erased and he's missing something important).

What Logic says: What are you smoking? There is no period of time within CANON that Sylar could be with Claire. Because before Homecoming, he was pretty much busy killing Molly's parents, scaring Matt and Audrey, killing Charlie...and after, he was in Primatech, then with Momo (all over the country) and killing Dale, and then in NYC getting drugged by Momo, and then trying to kill Peter, then visiting his lovely Darling Mermaid Darling mother Virginia, and killing Ted, and then fighting in Kirby plaza that night (I believe) before being stabbed and being sent to Somewhere In South America to meet up with the Wonder Siblings. And besides, the first time that they meet up after K.P. was in Claire's place. So there'd be no time for any of that to happen to let Sylar be mad enough to piss HRG off. And if they met before the series started? Claire lived in Texas, and Sylar lived in New York. He was just the adorkable watch-fixer before Papa Suresh found him. Claire wouldn't have been stupid enough to sleep with him. Also, HRG WOULD HAVE JUST KILLED HIM. He wouldn't have stopped at torturing and Haitianing Sylar (because remember: people don't kill people, daddies with pretty daughters do). And just how exactly would Sylar have found out that his mind was wiped if only those three knew? Elle wouldn't risk making Noah mad at her, HRG would definitely not tell him, and the Haitian doesn't talk (canonly) to anyone but Claire, HRG, and Matt (only when he's with HRG though).

Logic's final words: If Claire and Sylar were to ever become un-related again, it would have to be though Angela saying that she just manipulated everyone into believing that Sylar was her son. Because remember, Tim Kring had always wanted Peter and Claire to be related.

TOKYO – A 43-year-old player in a virtual game world became so angry about her sudden divorce from her online husband that she logged on with his password and killed his digital persona, police said Thursday.

The woman, who has been jailed on suspicion of illegally accessing a computer and manipulating electronic data, used his ID and password to log onto the popular interactive game "Maple Story" to carry out the virtual murder in May, a police official in the northern city of Sapporo said. He spoke on condition of anonymity because of department policy.

"I was suddenly divorced, without a word of warning. That made me so angry," the official quoted her as telling investigators and admitting the allegations.

The woman, a piano teacher, had not plotted any revenge in the real world, the official said.

She has not yet been formally charged. If convicted, she could face up to five years in prison or a fine up to $5,000.

Players in "Maple Story" create and manipulate digital images called "avatars" that represent themselves, while engaging in relationships, social activities and fighting monsters and other obstacles.

In virtual worlds, players often abandon their inhibitions, engaging in activity online that they would never do in the real world. For instance, sex with strangers is a common activity.

The woman used login information she got from the 33-year-old office worker when their characters were happily married to kill the character. The man complained to police when he discovered that his online avatar was dead.

The woman was arrested Wednesday and taken 620 miles from her home in southern Miyazaki to be detained in Sapporo, where the man lives, the official said.

The police official said he did not know if she was married in the real world.

Bad online behavior is usually handled within the rules set up by online worlds, which can ban miscreants or take away their virtual possessions.

In recent years, virtual lives have had consequences in the real world.

When bad deeds lead to criminal charges, prosecutors have found a real-world activity to cite — as in this case, in which the woman was charged with inappropriate computer access.

In August, a woman was charged in Delaware with plotting the real-life abduction of a boyfriend she met through the virtual reality Web site "Second Life."

In Tokyo, a 16-year-old boy was charged with stealing the ID and password from a fellow player of an online game in order to swindle virtual currency worth $360,000.

Virtual games are popular in Japan, and "Second Life" has drawn a fair number of Japanese participants. They rank third by nationality among users, after Americans and Brazilians.

--Source.

Leave me a comment saying "interview me."
I will ask you five questions.
Post the answers on your lj and then interview your friends!

1. If you had to choose only one DVD/CD/book to take with you on a desert island, what would they be?
DVD: Children of Men, because it's an amazing story about what could happen if the world suddenly became infertile.
CD: Adele's 19, because there's an extra CD in the case, plus she's amazing live. I loved her when she was on SNL.
Book: Kathy Reich's Monday Mourning. If I were stuck on a desert island and wanted to get a book stuck in my head, it'd be that one.

2. Do you believe in ghosts/supernatural?
I do, but I'm in denial. Because whenever I see something on tv about ghosts and stuff, or see something I don't want to see, my habits change or I stay up all night with some light on and don't go to bed until it's light out.

3. What would be worse for you: no more music or no more computer?
No more computer, because it gives me something to do. I tend to play FreeCell a lot, or Hearts. Minesweeper's good too.

4. Do you curse often?
Not often, but I curse more when I'm alone.

5. What is your biggest dream?
Just to find something to do with my life and move away from here.

So I went to check out the haunted house, and it's pretty cool.

We were showed around, and the woman showing us around, I think her name was Katie, said that they designed a room around my mom's boyfriend. He's supposed to be an escapee, and so when the people are leaving, they look over to the left and see a hole in the wall...but he's not in there, and he jumps out from the right and scares everyone toward the exit.

My room is after you go up the stairs...the first room is three teenage girls eating "people" and when the group gets into the middle of the room, a mother of one of the girls jumps out and moves them into the next room, which is the "Michael Meyers" room. Katie said that it was a scene from the latest Halloween movie, when he kills his father while he's watching television or whatever. From there, people get pushed through a bookcase into my room, which was called the "wax room"...there's a bunch of mannequins in the room and you're not supposed to know which one's real or not. It's my job to move them into the next room.

What's funny is that the room after mine, the guys building everything think it's haunted. Which...I don't know what to say about that. It's kinda funny, but not at the same time.

Anyway, I have to watch the last two episodes of PB, plus download tonight's episode sometime.

From  :

How many cats dwell in your home? Five
What are their descriptions/breeds? Mo is mostly black with some white on her chest and belly, Cloe is all white, Twinkie is a Maine coon cat and is orange, Jack is gray and tiger-ish, and Cheeto is like Twinkie but short-haired.
What are their names and nicknames? Mo: Mo-Mo. Cloe: Loki. Twinkie: Twink, Twinkstar, Twinkster, etc. Jack: Jack-Jack, Jackie. Cheeto: Queso.
How come you named them what you did; the history behind their names? I named Cloe. Jack was unnamed for a while, but one of her eyes closed for a bit, and so I started to call her One-Eyed Jack, though when her eye opened back up we called her Jack. And my mom named Twinkie after food, and when we found she was having kittens, she swore she'd name one of them after a food, hence Cheeto.
Are any of them related? Twinkie, Jack, and Cheeto are related.
Have any of them fathered/mothered kittens? Twinkie mothered Jack and Cheeto.
If so, how did the cats react to the kittens? They still get along.
Are they spayed/neutered? They all are.
Are they trained? Sort of...not really though.
Had you rescued any of your cats when you got them? Some of the ones in the past we have, but not really any from this group.
What is each cat’s personality? Mo is old and bitter, Cloe is...special, Twinkie is nice, Jack is EMO!, and Cheeto is pretty friendly.
Are any of your cats comedians? Yes.
Are any of them solemn? I don't know.
Do you feel they judge you? Sometimes.
Do your cats get along? For the most part they do, though Twinkie and Cloe start things.
Do you have any other pets? A dog and a bird.
If so, do your cats get along with them? Pretty much.
Do you give your cats treats? LOTS.
Do they know any tricks? Not really.
Are they introverted or extroverted? Extroverted, until there's someone loud.
Do they get along with people? Pretty much.
Do they have their claws? Yeah.
Are they respectful? Until it's time to come in for dinner.
Do they have any favorite toys; what toys? They like their sting-on-a-stick, the flashlight that has the red light, and the toy mice.
Do they dig catnip? Yep.
What kind of food are they fed? Dry food (I forget the brand) and Special Kitty canned cat food.
Do they beg for your food? Only if it's tuna.
Do they like tuna? Yeah...a lot.
Any of them like veggies or fruits? They like grass...but I think they'll eat anything.
Have any of them had fleas? Yeah :(
Have you ever given any of them a bath? Yes.
If so, how did they react? Cloe loved it, and Cheeto didn't mind.
Do your cats ever go wild during a full moon? No more than usual.
Do any of your cats particularly like music? Not really.
Do any of your cats have bad breath? I don't know.
Do any of your cats have health problems?
Have they ever challenged a dog?
Any of them ever randomly gone wild? Twinkie does that pretty often.
Do they like to be held? They all do, though Mo will complain a lot.
Do loud noises intimidate them? Yeah, though not Cloe because she's deaf.
How do they feel about whistling? Twinkie loves it.
Are they fearful of the vacuum cleaner? Only Cloe and Mo stick around.
Does a mower scare them? ^^
Have they ever caught spiders, cockroaches, moths, mice, or flies inside? Yeah, but not often.
If so, are they good exterminators, or do they just play with the pests? They play and eat them. Sometimes they bring stuff in.
Are any of them afraid of heights? Nope.
Do you think they form facial expressions? Sometimes they can look like they're smiling.
Do any of them smell like perfume, naturally? No...
Any of them smell not so good? Only when they're wet.
If so, what do you do about it? I dry them off.
Do any of them feel like mink or rabbit fur? Cloe does, after she gets shaved.
Any of them major shedders? Not really.
Do any of them have a tiny voice? Jack does sometimes.
How about a loud mouth? Mo and Cloe...and Cheeto can, when he's somewhere he doesn't want to be.
Do they like to get fur in your face? Twink does sometime.
Do they purr a lot? Cheeto does, and Twinkie.
Any of them like to roll? Mo, especially outside after my mom vacuumed.
Any of them like rubbing against legs, chairs, walls; basically everything? Cloe likes legs.
Any of them hyper? Twinkie can be sometimes.
Are any of them pretty carefree? Not really.
How about mischievous? Yeah.
Do they like to test the boundaries? Definitely.
Do they follow you around like shadows? Only when I have something they want.
Any of them like to throw fits? Cheeto does when he wants to go out but can't.
Ever tripped over any of your cats? Yeah.
Do any of them ever end up looking hilarious when trying to be menacing? Sometimes.
Have your cats ever been exposed to a frog or toad? Yeah.
If so, how did they react? They went after it.
Do shiny things scare them? No...Cloe loves it when the light reflects off it and she can chase the spots.
How do they feel about birds? They love them.
Do they think bags are great? Yeah.
Have you ever given them the round cap seal from a milk bottle to play with? Several times.
Do any of them fetch? No.
What are their greatest fears? Loud noises...though for Cloe it's something she doesn't see sneaking up on her.
Relay a funny incident about one of your cats: One time at Christmas, someone gave my mom's husband (at the time) a toolbox covered in wrapping paper, and Cloe took it off.
Are they good with children? Yeah.
Do they hide from strangers? Sometimes.
Do they claw the furniture? Not very often.
How old was each one when adopted? I don't know.
How old are they now? Cloe's like 12 now or something, J&Cheeto will be two next March, Mo is OLD (17?) and Twinkie is 5 or 6.
Have you ever moved with your cats? Not with Cheeto or Jack.
If so, how did they react to the move? They took it pretty well, though one time Mo went back to the old house.
Have you ever left your cats home alone while on vacation? Yes :(
If so, were they glad to see you return or didn’t care? Cheeto was glad.
Also if so, was the home a disaster? No.
Have you had any cats that have died? Blue died on my sister's bed, and Dobby and Ziggy went missing (at different times).
If so, how did the other cats, or you, deal with the grief? I just did.
What are their favorite activities? They like to go out, eat, and sleep.
Is there anything odd about each cat? Cheeto's a sissy and Cloe's deaf.
Do you feel they have souls? Sometimes.
Do any of them have a bell? Nope.
Any of them sport a fancy, or odd collar to match their personality? Nope.
Do you feel your cats are quite different than most cats? Cloe is, yeah.
Are they a gang, or are they loners? Mo is the only loner.
Do they spice life up for you? Oh, definitely.
Any of them like to lick you like a dog? No.
Do they ever go outside? They all do, and Cheeto gets pissed when he can't.
Do they like nature? Yeah.
Have any of them killed anything? Oh definitely.
Will they ever wear outfits? Not very often, though when I was younger, me and my sister used to dress up two of our cats in doll clothes.
If you live where there is snow, do they like the snow? No.
How do they feel about wrapped presents? They love
Do they get excited about packages? Not really.
Do they ever go in the car? Only when it's not running. Though Cloe loves rides.
Will they go with you to the park? They'll follow us around.
Do they ever pose for pictures? Sometimes.
Do they obey your commands? No.
Do they bite or scratch? Cheeto does.
Any of them moody like a teenager? Mo is (though she's more like an old woman)
What are their eye colors? I don't know exactly.
What large cats do you think each cat is most like? I don't know.
Are they protective of you? No.
Do they have a spiritual bond with you? I don't know.
Do they like being petted? Yes.
Do they like to be picked up? Most of the time.
Ever trimmed their claws; if so, how did that go? It never goes too well.
Have you ever carried them around on your shoulders? Yeah...mainly with Cheeto.
Any of them climbed into your bag and tried to hitch a ride with you? We have a wood bag, and sometimes they get in there for "rides".
Are they leash trained? Cloe is.
How do they feel about the vet? I don't know.
Are they timid or adventurous? They're mostly adventurous, though Cloe gets timid outside (she's deaf).
Do they smile? I think so.
Do they stare? Yes.
Do they ever hold grudges? Not really.
Are they friendly? Most of the time. Though Mo can get grouchy.
Do they climb on counters or cabinets? Yeah.
Do they think you are a jungle gym? No.
Have any of them ever gotten caught in a couch? No.
Have any of them ever gotten caught in a closet or cabinet? Probably.
Do they climb into bookshelves? Yes.
Do they have any cat condos? They have one in the living room.
Where do they sleep? Anywhere, though Cheeto mainly sleeps on my bed or on the couch.
How do they feel about musical instruments, if they ever encounter them? They're like 'wtf?'
Do they do anything they know drives you crazy? I can't have any plastic bags on my floor or Twinkie will go after them.
Do you love your cats? Is Clay Aiken gay? Is Edward Cullen a stalker vampire boyfriend?
Do your cats love you back? I hope so.
Could you live without your cats? I could, but I'd rather live with them.
Do your cats run everything, or do you? We both run the show.

1. If you were to die today, what would your last words be?
Something along the lines of, "Oh, come on!"

2. What would you want your epitaph to say?
"Fade to Black". Because that's how I am, and I'm sure people would get mad if it turned out to be a reference to something else.

Comment on this post. I will choose seven interests from your profile and you will explain what they mean and why you are interested in them. Post this along with your answers in your own journal so others can play along.

Boston Red Sox.
My family is full of Red Sox fans. Everyone I know of is a Red Sox fan. (I'm sure if they're a Yankee fan, they're shunned, for being a non-believer. You probably didn't get that. If you didn't, don't try to figure it out.) Because a long time ago, one was raised to be a Red Sox fan. And when they got married (to another Red Sox fan) they passed it onto their children. And so on, and so forth. I was raised around people who would curse if the Red Sox didn't get in, but they would also say, "Hey, there's always next year." And then one time, they did it. :) (Oh, and me at my only Red Sox game.)

Crime Fiction.
Well, really, it's mainly Kathy Reichs, but I guess Max Allan Collins can count too, because he wrote the CSI books. I read the CSI books because in GSRville, Cold Burn is a big one. So I read that, and got all the others up to Grave Matters, minus the graphic novel. And because of CSI, I watched Bones. And when I learned that Bones was based off books by Kathy Reichs, I got myself to the library and picked up Monday Mourning (which isn't the first in the series.). Sometimes I read my crime novels to get rid of the SPARKLEY VAMPIRES OF DOOM. I have 18.

Fanfiction.
I like fanfiction because it's a continuation. It's what people get from imagining, "What if X went with Y to ____ instead of to ____ with Z?" Or, "What if Michael came out and told Sara the truth instead of having Nika steal the keys?"

Mogget.
I love Mogget. He is a white cat from Garth Nix's Abhorsen trilogy. He has a red collar and is bound to serve the Abhorsen. He talks. He's sarcastic, rude, and he sleeps a lot. He's pretty much my favorite character from the trilogy. Just remember: don't remove his collar.

Shawn Spencer.
What's not to love about a fake psychic? He's awesome, really. He's funny. And I loved him in Lights, Camera ... Homicidio. And Black and Tan: A Crime of Fashion. There was also that season 1 episode with George Takei (Shawn vs The Red Phantom?) and he just mentions "The San Antonio Incident" like it's real...and then it turns out in the end that it was...at least in Psych-dom. Oh, and he's kinda hot.

The Virgin Suicides.
The first I ever heard of The Virgin Suicides was the movie, when it was on Lifetime or whatever. So a couple years ago, I got it. And was a little upset that the whole thing was pretty much focused on LUX.(Really?) Cecilia, my fave, got barely any screen time. And I wanted to get the book, but I never did because it's like $14, and I didn't have enough before, and I could now, but I never remember. (Though I just found a PDF.)  But when I got the movie from Borders, everyone started to worry about me a little...

Wicked.
I had to read the book for the summer extra credit deal. Turns out that my teacher wasn't going to take the papers, but it's not like I did it anyway. But I had heard my Freshman English teacher mention it, and so when I saw it on the list, I bought it. And I loved it. And I fell in love with Elphie. And Galinda was a little weird at first, but she was good in the end. (And isn't it great how at the end, Maguire said that the broom was burned beyond recognition, so Dorthy had to take the green bottle, and after the Wizard saw it, he left? And then in Son of a Witch, the bottle was never mentioned?) Also, I shipped Nor/Liir. (And it kinda makes me mad that Liir never found Nor in Son of a Witch. Grr.)
